intro: Onosma lycaonica, commonly known as the Lycaonia hedge mustard, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbages. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with small, lance-shaped leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
